definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To quickly lower the head or body, often in order to prevent it from being struck by something.
examples: Duck ! There's a branch falling off the tree!

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To quickly lower (the head or body), often in order to prevent it from being struck by something.
( transitive ) To lower (something) into water; to thrust or plunge under liquid and suddenly withdraw.
( intransitive ) To go under the surface of water and immediately reappear; to plunge one's head into water or other liquid.
( transitive , figurative ) To evade doing something, especially something considered a responsibility .
( transitive ) To lower the volume of (a sound) so that other sounds in the mix can be heard more clearly.
( intransitive , colloquial ) To enter a place for a short moment.
examples: I'm just going to duck into the loo for a minute; can you hold my bag?

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To quickly lower the head or body, often in order to prevent it from being struck by something.

( intransitive ) To go under the surface of water and immediately reappear; to plunge one's head into water or other liquid.
( transitive , figurative ) To evade doing something, especially something considered a responsibility .
( transitive ) To lower the volume of (a sound) so that other sounds in the mix can be heard more clearly.
( intransitive , colloquial ) To enter a place for a short moment.

definitions.definition: To surreptitiously leave a rubber duck on someone's parked Jeep as an act of kindness (see Jeep ducking ).

main_definition: ( transitive ) To surreptitiously leave a rubber duck on someone's parked Jeep as an act of kindness (see Jeep ducking ).
